Package org.asteroid.math

Class Set<E>

java.lang.Object
org.asteroid.math.Set<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of elements in this set
public class Set<E> extends Object
This class contains functions to perform operations based on Sets

  • Constructor Details

    • Set

      public Set()

  • Method Details

    • contains

      public boolean contains(E item)
      Checks for existence of an item in the set
      Parameters:
      item - item to check for presence in the set
      Returns:
      True if the item is in the set else returns false

    • setUniversal

      public void setUniversal(Set<E> universalSet)
      Assigns a universal set to this instance of set
      Parameters:
      universalSet - Instance of set that is to be assigned as universal set of this instance of Set

    • add

      public boolean add(E item)
      Add an item to this instance of Set.
      NOTE: If a universal set exists and it doesn't contains the given item then the item is not added and returns false to represent that the item is not added to the Set
      Parameters:
      item - Item that is to be added to Set
      Returns:
      true if the item is added to the set else false

    • size

      public int size()
      returns the size of the Set
      Returns:
      Size of the set

    • get

      public E get(int index)
      Returns the item at the respective index.
      NOTE: The indexing of the item is based on when it was added. If the item is added at the first then its index is 0, the second one is indexed as 1 and so on.
      Parameters:
      index - index to access the item
      Returns:
      item at the respective index

    • addAll

      public int addAll(E[] items)
      Add an array of elements in the set
      Parameters:
      items - Array of items that is to be added
      Returns:
      Number of items that are added to the set

    • adds

      public int adds(E... items)
      Add an sequence of elements in the set
      Parameters:
      items - Items that is to be added
      Returns:
      Number of items that are added to the set

    • addAll

      public int addAll(Collection<E> items)
      Add an Collection of elements in the set
      Parameters:
      items - Collection of items that is to be added
      Returns:
      Number of items that are added to the set

    • getPowerSet

      public Set<Set<E>> getPowerSet()
      Generates power set of current instance of set. (Power Set is the set of all subset of a set including empty set and the set itself)
      Returns:
      Power Set of the current instance of the set

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String representation of the Set instance

    • clone

      public Set<E> clone()
      Creates and returns a copy of this Set.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      Clone of the current instance of Set

    • union

      public Set<E> union(Set<E> set)
      Returns union (Union of set refers to the set that is the combination of both the set) of two sets
      Parameters:
      set - The second Set
      Returns:
      Union of this instance of set and the function argument set

    • intersection

      public Set<E> intersection(Set<E> set)
      Returns intersection (Intersection of set refers to the set that is formed from the common elements of the two set) of two sets
      Parameters:
      set - The second Set
      Returns:
      Intersection of this instance of set and the function argument set

    • getComplement

      public Set<E> getComplement()
      Generates complement (Complement refers to set that are not in the Set) of the Set.
      NOTE: Complements requires a universal set to be assigned. If the instance of Set doesn't contains a universal set then an exception is raised
      Returns:
      Complement of the Set

    • isPerfectSupersetOf

      public boolean isPerfectSupersetOf(Set<E> set)
      Checks if argument set is a perfect superset of the current instance of Set (Perfect Superset refers to subset which is not the same as its subset)
      Parameters:
      set - Set to check if it is a perfect superset
      Returns:
      true if the given set is perfect superset of this instance of this Set else false

    • isPerfectSubsetOf

      public boolean isPerfectSubsetOf(Set<E> set)
      Checks if argument set is a perfect subset of the current instance of Set (Perfect subset refers to subset which is not the same as its superset)
      Parameters:
      set - Set to check if it is a perfect subset
      Returns:
      true if the given set is perfect subset of this instance of this Set else false

    • isSupersetOf

      public boolean isSupersetOf(Set<E> set)
      Checks if argument set is a superset of the current instance of Set
      Parameters:
      set - Set to check if it is a superset
      Returns:
      true if the given set is superset of this instance of this Set else false

    • isSubsetOf

      public boolean isSubsetOf(Set<E> set)
      Checks if argument set is a subset of the current instance of Set
      Parameters:
      set - Set to check if it is a subset
      Returns:
      true if the given set is subset of this instance of this Set else false

    • cartesianProduct

      public Set<ArrayList> cartesianProduct(Set set)
      Generates and returns Cartesian Product of two set. Here the current instance is the first set and the argument of this function is the second set
      Parameters:
      set - The second set to find the Cartesian Product
      Returns:
      Cartesian product

    • difference

      public Set<E> difference(Set<E> b)
      Calculate difference of two set. Here the argument passed in the function is the second set for the operation
      Parameters:
      b - the second set for the operation
      Returns:
      difference between two set

    • symmetricDifference

      public Set<E> symmetricDifference(Set<E> b)
      Calculate symmetric difference between two set. (Symmetric difference is A-B U B-A)
      Parameters:
      b - Another set to find symmetric difference
      Returns:
      Symmetric difference of two sets
